reviews.text: Nice hotel and good value. Stayed there oct 2002 and Jun 2003. Good not believe they were still digging up the road outside the front door a year later. Anyone who does not like walking must be prepared to walk at least 15 mins to the main attractions of this underated city.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: We travelled to Turin for a weekend break in January 2008 from Luton on Easyjet.
We caught the bus from the airport and it stops at the train station just 100 meters from The Genio.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Genio

reviews.text: My husband emailed the hotel prior to us arriving and we got a free upgrade on our room, and stayed on the top floor (4th) in the corner room 440. I was glad we got this as seeing photos of the standard rooms I thought they looked dated and shabby.The room had great views of the city and the Alps in the distance. The hotel common spaces are nicely decorated. The breakfast, was ok but not really my cup of tea, bread and pastries which are nowhere near as nice as in the cafes in Turin, also yoghurts and fruit which had obviously come out of a tin.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel
Very Good
reviews.text: Turin is a lovely city and we walked for miles and miles. We went up the Mole to get the best views of the city. We went into lots of cafe/bars and were amazed to get nibbles included in the price. Our favourite place was in Piazza San Carlo, which was a grand old building and had a large table in the middle with lots of Italian snacks which you just helped yourself too.

reviews.title: Another Characterful Best Western In Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's hard to use the word budget when you are paying in Euro but this hotel fit the bill. I was looking for a place that would be decent after I traveled half a day to reach it but it didn't need to have a lot on offer as I was only staying a night. The location next to the train station gave me pause at first but made no difference in the end. This hotel is well maintained and the staff is very attentive. They placed me in a smoking room and when I asked to move they took care of it immediately and even gave me a better room. The hotel is well located for transport and walking around the center of Torino. The breakfast that is included with the room is also another positive. It was a pretty impressive spread for a hotel of this type. Eggs, pastries, fruit, cheese, yogurt. I have stayed in better places with worst breakfast. Torino is definitely worth a visit with lots of historical sites, good shopping and a local vibe almost everywhere you go. If I head back I'll probably look to book this place again. The price is right and so is everything else.
reviews.title: Good budget option

reviews.text: Room was set up well for business travel ... internet access was very good from room. Breakfast was served 7-10am, but I didn't eat there. Bed was average, but linens were clean. Room had a desk and comfortable chairs, so working in the room was nice. Great location ... next to train station at the end of Via Roma ... convenient walk to all the attractions and sights. Quiet at night. Clean bathroom. Maid service was very good.
reviews.title: Good place for business travel

reviews.text: This was just the place for a stopover. Spent one night here, as the Sex Pistols were playing the Traffic Festival, and I couldn't miss that - but that's another story.... Perfect location, right next to the central station, therefore very easy to get in and out the next day. I took a single room, travelling solo as I was, which was a little small, but all the standard facilities were there, all was clean and comfortable, and no problems whatsoever checking in or out. Recommended.
reviews.title: Perfect central location for a short stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights with my husband and co-worker for the Salone del Gusto. I booked more than 6 months in advance and got a great rate.
reviews.title: Fantastic Room and Hotel- NOT a chain hotel experience

likes.liked: — great bed, large rooms, great location

reviews.text: When we arrived at this Best Western, the check in was efficient and very friendly and helpful. We had room 325 and when we entered the room we could not believe the size!! King bed and a single, huge bathroom with great shower, heated towel rack, etc, and a great balcony overlooking Corso Vittorio Emanuele. We had more than enough space for all 3 of us and during a 19 day stay in Italy, this was by far our most comfortable bed and pillows.
reviews.title: A bit expenssive but good location

description: Classic hotel with modern amenities & continental breakfast; located in city center near Porta Nuova Station and Egyptian Museum.
